name: Wintergreen Resort & Conference Center

reviews.title: bates motel part 2
reviews.text: We have traveled extensively throughout the US and stayed in hundreds of hotels and nothing compared to this. This was the Bates Motel part 2. The room was filthy: blood on the matress, no hot water, cigarette burns on the carpet, blankets and bedspread and infestation of bugs due to a large hole in the window screen. We complained to the management and they acted like they were disinterested. They advertised TV with cable channels and all we got was one local channel that was predominately snowy. The bed was so uncomfortable that we had three sleepless nights. We are ready for another vacation to recover from this nightmare of a stay.

reviews.title: 2nd Time Not a Charm
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Wintergreen. The first stay was very nice, so I was surprised at this trip. The bed was horrible! We had a whirlpool suite. Was not worth the money. We will stick to the Ho Chunk Hotel from now on. At least until we have grandchildren and will be going back to the waterpark hotels. Kalahari, Wilderness or Great Wolf Lodge are all great for families with children.

reviews.title: Did not like the wintergreen
reviews.text: OLD, OLD, OLD. Needs remodeling desperately! The bedspreads did not match the wall paper, the draperies were so old, heavy and dark! Just a depressing place to stay. The hallways were the same.

reviews.title: Nothing to brag about!
reviews.text: Also had trouble with our room keys!!! Don't stay here, you'll get depressed! Also, the beds were just awful!! Way too hard and uncomfortable, the pillows were razor thin too! Won't do that again!

reviews.title: The Wintergreen ROCKS!
reviews.text: A very nice hotel, dont get me wrong, The beds are like boards. The Bar & lounge was not open, due to a wedding in the banquet room, which isnt near the bar area, and of course this was a private wedding. Which I have no complaints, but why have a Bar on the property for all guests, and not be open to the one's who were singled out?... as for the Dinning?... forget it, that wasnt open either, we had to go elsewhere to eat. The whole Idea I choose this Hotel was the Bar & resturant on the property. I didnt want to have to drink & drive around the Dells area On a Saturday Night.... I do not recommend this hotel, I was not happy... Also.... You can't use the phones in your room, unless you either have a credit card, or a 20.00 deposit. I had a calling card, to call my son, and had to find a pay phone to use. And to top it off, the bathroom light bulb was burnt out, I called the front desk. ( NO CHARGE).. to bring a bulb, the woman who brought it didnt know how to change a lightbulb...SO I stood on the toilet and changed it.... Do I need to say more????.

reviews.title: Nothin' to write home about...
reviews.text: We stayed at this 'resort' August 5 & 6 2007 and had an okay time. The Mt Olympus tickets were a pretty good deal, where we had a REALLY great time (especially Poseidon's Rage), but the hotel rates about a 2.5.

reviews.title: it's ok
reviews.text: I've travelled a lot for business and this spot would never measure up. The in-room coffee pot made some pee-colored beverage, but it wasn't coffee. The beds were reasonably comfortable, but the room was lacking in towels (there were 3 adults and 1 child, and two towels), the drain to the tub was broken, the tv only got a handful of cable channels. The 'room service' wasn't service at all -- our first night, we ordered a pizza because we wanted something quick, and the person on the other end of the line asked "You pick it up?" Yikes! The restaurant was deserted every time I went in there (mostly to get a cup of coffee).

reviews.title: Bad! Bad! Bad!
reviews.text: The 'waterpark' was a decent size indoor pool, one kiddie slide (which was fun for the kid), and an outdoor area that looked mostly broken down. The 'snack shack' outdoors never opened the two days we were there. The gift shop never had anybody working in it. It's almost like they were closed for the season, or getting ready to close.

reviews.title: Bad experience after bad experience
reviews.text: On the plus side, the location was convenient (right by I-90/94, near restaurants & a cool video game arcade/bowling alley), the patio doors right by the parking lot made it easy to load/unload, and the room was dark and quiet (thanks to heavy drapes) that was nice during a thunderstorm. And, did I mention the room was cheap ($107/night included $30 tickets to Mt. Olympus)?

reviews.title: Get what you pay for! Mt. Olympus not worth it!!!
reviews.text: Next time we go back to the Dells, we'll stay at a different place; the Mt Olympus tickets weren't worth it. These folks, while very cordial, have a lot to learn about service.

reviews.title: I would not go back or send anyone else here.....
reviews.text: I stayed at the Wintergreen in July/Aug of 2007 and was somewhat disappointed in the "resort". I called the night before and was told my room would be ready for an early check in by 1 PM at the latest. We arrived at 1:30PM to find our room was still not ready and it was not ready until 3:30PM...quite some early check in. Once I finally checked in, I was not offered any assistance with luggage, a baggage cart, or any directions to my room. After finding my way through the somewhat smelly stairways, I found my room which was a non-smoking room that obviously was recently converted because the first thing on my list to buy was air freshener. The room was alright for $109 per night with a queen size bed, sleeper sofa, and "4 person whirlpool" that really fits 2 people. I wanted to order room service the first night but did not have a menu in the room and when I called

reviews.title: Look elsewhere......
reviews.text: the front desk for one and the restaurant, they kept bouncing me back

reviews.title: Hated this hotel
reviews.text: and forth and never got me a menu. I ended up ordering pizza from the

reviews.title: Pretty nice place for the price.
reviews.text: restaurant--would not do it again. As for the "water park", it is

reviews.title: Exceptional experience at the Wintergreen Resort
reviews.text: nothing but a few kiddie slides and one mid sized slide that was not even on when we were there. The ice machine was broken as was the only dryer in the resort. The room was clean and organized but was filled with outdated and old furniture. The second day there, I was woke by the banging of a maintenance man saying that the whirlpool was leaking to the downstairs room and the one above us was leaking into our room. Overall, this "resort" needs to get their act together. I definitely would not go back after my experience and would rather spend an extra 30 or 40 bucks a night to stay at a nicer
My mom and I went to the Wintergreen for a one night stay to do some shopping at the Tanger Outlet Mall and to go to the casino.
reviews.title: Perfect!!

likes.liked: — Clean and location to the mall.
likes.disliked: — The size of the in room TV.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and room were very clean. I took a glance into the indoor waterpark area, which looked very clean as well.
reviews.title: Uck!

reviews.text: We were very impressed with the hotel for what we paid. I received a rate of $65 from Expedia and it was well worth it.
reviews.title: Great experience, fantastic staff, and wonderful rooms

likes.liked: — The clean rooms, great rates, excellent food, and amazing staff. The meeting rooms and meeting accomodations were top notch.

reviews.text: The only thing that I thought was cheesy was the TV in the room. I think it was a 20" or smaller.
reviews.title: Wonderful conference !!!
Stay away from this motel - Not worth the money
reviews.text: They also included a 10% discount off of breakfast or lunch at their restaurant. So, we had breakfast there the next morning. The restaurant was clean and breakfast was tasty.

description: The Wintergreen Resort is perfect for your next meeting, group function, or family vacation. Relax and enjoy our indoor pool, jacuzzi, sauna, and children's water facilities. Our convenient onsite restaurant and lounge are sure to please any appetite.  If  searching for a romantic getaway, our whirlpool rooms will accommodate every couple with room service and special packages. Centrally located just off I90 makes it a perfect location for all to visit.
